features.name: Paladin Proficiencies
features.desc: Paladins are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, with all types of armor (heavy, medium, and light), and with shields (except tower shields).

features.name: Smite Evil
features.desc:
Once per day, a paladin can call out to the powers of good to aid her in her struggle against evil. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the paladin chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is evil, the paladin adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Cha{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and adds her paladin level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of her smite, smite evil attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess.
In addition, while smite evil is in effect, the paladin gains a deflection bonus equal to her Charisma modifier (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of the smite. If the paladin targets a creature that is not evil, the smite is wasted with no effect.
The smite evil lasts until the target dies or the paladin selects a new target. At 4th level, and at every three levels thereafter, the paladin may smite evil one additional time per day.

features.name: Alignment Restriction
features.desc: A paladin who ceases to be lawful good loses all paladin {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and class features. She cannot thereafter gain levels as a paladin until she changes the {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} back.

features.name: Divine Grace
features.desc: At 2nd level, a paladin gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}.

features.name: Lay On Hands
features.desc:
Beginning at 2nd level, a paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} wounds (her own or those of others) by {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g}. Each day she can use this ability a number of times equal to 1/2 her paladin level plus her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every two paladin levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, unless the paladin targets herself, in which case it is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
Alternatively, a paladin can use this healing power to deal damage to undead creatures, dealing 1d6 points of damage for every two levels the paladin possesses. Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee touch {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage.

features.name: Aura of Courage
features.desc:
At 3rd level, a paladin is immune to fear (magical or otherwise). Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.

features.name: Divine Health
features.desc: At 3rd level, a paladin is immune to all diseases, including supernatural and magical diseases, including mummy rot.

features.name: Mercy
features.desc:
At 3rd level, and every three levels thereafter, a paladin can select one mercy.
Each mercy adds an effect to the paladin's lay on hands ability. Whenever the paladin uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to one target, the target also receives the additional effects from all of the mercies possessed by the paladin.

features.name: Smite Evil — Additional Use
features.desc:
Once per day, a paladin can call out to the powers of good to aid her in her struggle against evil. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the paladin chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is evil, the paladin adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Cha{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and adds her paladin level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of her smite, smite evil attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess.
In addition, while smite evil is in effect, the paladin gains a deflection bonus equal to her Charisma modifier (if any) to her {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of the smite. If the paladin targets a creature that is not evil, the smite is wasted with no effect.
The smite evil lasts until the target dies or the paladin selects a new target. At 4th level, and at every three levels thereafter, the paladin may smite evil one additional time per day.

features.name: Channel Positive Energy
features.desc:
When a paladin reaches 4th level, she gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural ability{/g} to channel positive energy like a cleric. Using this ability consumes two uses of her lay on hands ability. This energy can be used to cause or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, depending on the creatures targeted.
A paladin channels positive energy and can choose to deal damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures.
Channeling positive energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the paladin. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage plus 1d6 points of damage for every two paladin levels beyond 1st (2d6 at 4th, 3d6 at 5th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the paladin's level + the paladin's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum hit point total—all excess healing is lost.
This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.

features.name: Divine Bond
features.desc:
Upon reaching 5th level, a paladin forms a divine bond with her god. This bond can take one of two forms. Once the form is chosen, it cannot be changed.
The first type of bond allows a paladin to form a divine bond with her weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, disruption, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, and {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.
The second type of bond allows a paladin to gain the service of an unusually {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}intelligent{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strong{/g}, and loyal steed to serve her in her crusade against evil. This mount is a heavy horse. This mount functions as a druid's animal companion, using the paladin's level as her effective druid level.
At 11th level, the mount gains the celestial creature simple template.
At 15th level, a paladin's mount gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to the paladin's level + 11.

features.name: Aura of Resolve
features.desc:
At 8th level, a paladin is immune to charm {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}. Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.

features.name: Mark of Justice
features.desc:
At 11th level, a paladin can expend two uses of her smite evil ability to grant the ability to smite evil to all allies for 1 minute, using her {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g}. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the paladin chooses one target within sight to smite. If this target is evil, the paladin's allies add her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus (if any) to their {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and add her paladin level to all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of her smite. Smite evil attacks automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess.
In addition, while smite evil is in effect, the paladin's allies gain a deflection bonus equal to her Charisma bonus (if any) to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against attacks made by the target of this smite. If the paladin targets a creature that is not evil, this smite is wasted with no effect.

features.name: Aura of Faith
features.desc:
At 14th level, a paladin's weapons are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Any {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} made against an enemy within 10 feet of her is treated as good-aligned for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.

features.name: Aura of Righteousness
features.desc:
At 17th level, a paladin gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/evil and immunity to compulsion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}. Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against compulsion effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.

features.name: Holy Champion
features.desc: At 20th level, a paladin becomes a conduit for the power of her god. Her {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} increases to 10/evil and whenever she channels positive energy or uses lay on hands to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a creature, she heals the maximum possible amount.

features.name: Divine Hunter Proficiencies
features.desc: Divine hunters are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, with light and medium armor, and with shields (except tower shields).

features.name: Precise Shot
features.desc: You can shoot or throw ranged weapons at an opponent engaged in melee without taking the standard –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}.

features.name: Shared Precision
features.desc: At 3rd level, when a divine hunter hits a creature with a {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attack{/g}, she grants her allies within 10 feet of her the benefit of the Precise Shot {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} against that target for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Her allies must remain within 10 feet of her, and must be able both to see and hear the divine hunter to gain this benefit.

features.name: Divine Hunter Bond
features.desc:
Upon reaching 5th level, a divine hunter forms a divine bond with her ranged weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, merciful, and {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.

features.name: Distant Mercy
features.desc:
At 6th level, a divine hunter can expend two uses of her lay on hands ability to use her lay on hands ability on a target within 5 feet per paladin level.
A paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} the wounds of others by {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g}. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every two paladin levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.
Alternatively, a paladin can use this healing power to deal damage to undead creatures, dealing 1d6 points of damage for every two levels the paladin possesses. Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee touch {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage.

features.name: Aura of Clear Sight
features.desc: At 8th level, a paladin is immune to blindness (magical or otherwise). Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against blindness effects.

features.name: Divine Hunter Bond
features.desc:
Upon reaching 5th level, a divine hunter forms a divine bond with her ranged weapon. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she can call upon the aid of a celestial spirit for 1 minute per paladin level.
At 5th level, this spirit grants the weapon a +1 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. For every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. These bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5.
Alternatively, they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties: axiomatic, brilliant energy, flaming, flaming burst, holy, keen, merciful, and {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g}. Adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the property's cost. These bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has, but duplicate abilities do not stack.
A paladin can use this ability once per day at 5th level, and one additional time per day for every four levels beyond 5th, to a total of four times per day at 17th level.

features.name: Hunter's Blessing
features.desc: At 11th level, a divine hunter can expend a use of her smite evil ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} to grant herself and all allies within 10 feet the Deadly Aim, Precise Shot, and Improved Precise Shot {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, even if they lack the prerequisites. The effects last for 1 minute. Evil creatures gain no benefit from this ability.

features.name: Righteous Hunter
features.desc: At 14th level, a divine hunter's ranged weapons are treated as {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good-aligned{/g} for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. Any {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g} made by an ally within 10 feet of her are likewise treated as good-aligned for the purposes of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction. This ability functions only while the divine hunter is conscious.

features.name: Channel Positive Energy
features.desc:
When a hospitaler reaches 4th level, she gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural ability{/g} to channel positive energy like a cleric. She can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. Using this ability does not expend uses of lay on hands, as it does with other paladins. This energy can be used to cause or {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, depending on the creatures targeted.
A hospitaler channels positive energy and can choose to deal damage to undead creatures or to heal living creatures.
Channeling positive energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the hospitaler. The amount of damage dealt or healed is equal to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage at 4th level plus 1d6 points of damage for every two hospitaler levels beyond 4th (2d6 at 6th, 3d6 at 8th, and so on). Creatures that take damage from channeled energy receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to halve the damage. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the hospitaler's level + the hospitaler's Charisma modifier. Creatures healed by channel energy cannot exceed their maximum hit point total—all excess healing is lost.
This is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that does not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.

features.name: Aura of Life
features.desc: At 11th level, a hospitaler is immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} effects. Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against death effects. This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is unconscious or dead.

features.name: Guarding Hands
features.desc:
Beginning at 2nd level, a paladin can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} wounds (her own or those of others) by {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g}. Each day she can use this ability a number of times equal to 1/2 her paladin level plus her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. With one use of this ability, a paladin can heal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every two paladin levels she possesses. Using this ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, unless the paladin targets herself or her divine troth, in which case it is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Despite the name of this ability, a paladin only needs one free hand to use this ability.
Alternatively, a paladin can use this healing power to deal damage to undead creatures, dealing 1d6 points of damage for every two levels the paladin possesses. Using lay on hands in this way requires a successful melee touch {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. Undead do not receive a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} against this damage.

features.name: Divine Troth
features.desc: Once per day the divine guardian pledges her protection to a willing creature for the day.

features.name: Courageous Defense
features.desc: At 3rd level a divine guardian can intercept {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} directed at the target of her divine troth as if she had the Bodyguard and In Harm's Way {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}. The divine guardian's aura of courage does not grant a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to allies within 10 feet, but still grants her immunity to fear effects.

features.name: Divine Guardian Bonus Feat
features.desc: A divine guardian gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} at 7th level, and additional bonus feats at 10th and 13th level. These bonus feats must be chosen from the following list: Combat Reflexes, Diehard, Dodge, Endurance, Great Fortitude, Improved Great Fortitude, Iron Will, Improved Iron Will, Lightning Reflexes, Improved Lightning Reflexes, Missile Shield, Shield Focus, Toughness, or Tower Shield Proficiency.

features.name: Power of Faith
features.desc: At 4th level, the warrior of the holy light gains one additional use of her lay on hands ability per day. She gains one additional use of lay on hands per day for every four levels she attains beyond 4th. She can spend a use of her lay on hands ability to call upon the power of her faith as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. This causes a nimbus of light to emanate from the warrior of the holy light in a 30-foot radius. All allies in this area (including the warrior of the holy light) receive a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear as long as they remain in the area of light. This power lasts for 1 minute.

features.name: Power of Faith
features.desc: At 8th level, the nimbus of light {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} the paladin and her allies, curing of them of {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, as per the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} lesser restoration. A creature can only be healed in this way once per day.

features.name: Power of Faith
features.desc: At 12th level, the nimbus of light grants allies in the area resistance 30 to fire, acid, cold, electricity and sonic energy.

features.name: Shining Light
features.desc: At 14th level, a warrior of the holy light can unleash a 30-foot burst of pure, white light as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. evil creatures within this burst take ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} for every two paladin levels) points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and are blinded for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Evil dragons, evil outsiders, and evil undead are blinded for 1d4 rounds on a failed {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g}. A Reflex save halves this damage and negates the blindness. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the warrior of the holy light's level + the warrior of the holy light's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier. good creatures within this burst are {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} 1d6 points of damage per two paladin levels and receive a +2 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, saving throws, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} for 1 round. A warrior of the holy light can use this ability once per day at 14th level plus one additional time per day at 17th and 20th levels.

features.name: Power of Faith
features.desc: At 16th level, the nimbus of light grants the warrior of the holy light and her allies protection from {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g}. There is a 25% chance that critical hits made against the warrior of the holy light and her allies in the area are instead treated as normal hits. This does not stack with other abilities that grant similar protection (such as light fortification).

features.name: Power of Faith
features.desc: At 20th level, the nimbus of light increases in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} out to a range of 50 feet. In addition, all of its {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g} increase. The morale bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear increases to +2. The amount of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d4{/g}. Finally, protection against {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} increases to 50%.

features.name: Stigmata
features.desc: As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the martyr can chant hymns of faith and cause bleeding stigmata to visibly appear on his body; at 7th level, he can manifest stigmata as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}, and at 13th level, he can do so as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. He can use this ability a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to (4 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier) at 1st level, plus 1 additional round per day for each level beyond 1st. While his stigmata are active, he takes 1 point of bleed {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, which automatically ceases when he ends this ability but otherwise does not relent, even in the face of magical {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} or Heal {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}. His stigmata assist his allies, duplicating inspire courage bardic performance of a bard of his paladin level. At 10th level, he can choose to duplicate the effects of inspire greatness. At 16th level, he can choose to duplicate the effects of inspire heroics.

features.name: Inspire Courage
features.desc: A 1st-level bard can use his performance to inspire courage in his allies (including himself), bolstering them against fear and improving their combat abilities. To be affected, an ally must be able to perceive the bard's performance. An affected ally receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm and fear effects and a +1 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. At 5th level, and every six bard levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +1, to a maximum of +4 at 17th level.

features.name: See No Evil, Hear No Evil
features.desc: At 2nd level, the martyr and all allies within 20 feet of him gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against sonic effects and gaze {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. This ability functions only when the martyr is conscious.

features.name: Aura of Health
features.desc: At 3rd level, the martyr and all allies within 20 feet of him gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against diseases. This ability functions only when the martyr is conscious.

features.name: Martyr's Mercy
features.desc:
At 3rd level, a martyr can apply any of the mercies for which he qualifies based on his paladin level to his lay on hands, even if he didn't select that mercy (or its prerequisites). However, when he uses a mercy he didn't select, he loses his Aura of {g|Encyclopedia:HP}Health{/g} or See No Evil, Hear No Evil aura (depending on the mercy) for one {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. As long as martyr's aura is disabled, he cannot apply corresponding mercies.
The martyr can use lay on hands on any ally within short range, rather than needing to {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch{/g} the ally.

features.name: Aura Mastery
features.desc: The martyr's aura of courage, aura of resolve, and aura of righteousness have a radius of 20 feet instead of 10 feet, but the martyr does not gain immunity to fear, charms, or compulsions from those abilities.

features.name: Aura of Courage
features.desc:
At 3rd level, a paladin is immune to fear (magical or otherwise). Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.

features.name: Bardic Performance (Move Action)
features.desc: At 7th level, a bard can start a bardic performance as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g} instead of a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}.

features.name: Aura of Resolve
features.desc:
At 8th level, a paladin is immune to charm {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}. Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.

features.name: Inspire Greatness
features.desc: A bard of 9th level or higher can use his performance to inspire greatness in all allies within 30 feet, granting extra fighting capability. A creature inspired with greatness gains 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} (d10s), the commensurate number of temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} (apply the target's {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier, if any, to these bonus Hit Dice), a +2 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, and a +1 competence bonus on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.

features.name: Bardic Performance (Swift Action)
features.desc: At 13th level, a bard can start a bardic performance as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.

features.name: Inspire Heroics
features.desc: A bard of 15th level or higher can inspire tremendous heroism in all allies within 30 feet. Inspired creatures gain a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} and a +4 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. The effect lasts for as long as the targets are able to witness the performance.

features.name: Aura of Righteousness
features.desc:
At 17th level, a paladin gains {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 5/evil and immunity to compulsion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like abilities{/g}. Each ally within 10 feet of her gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against compulsion effects.
This ability functions only while the paladin is conscious, not if she is {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or dead.

features.name: Studied Target
features.desc:
A character can study an opponent he can see as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. The character then gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against it. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of character class abilities against that opponent increase by 1.
If a character deals sneak attack damage to a target, he studies that target, allowing him to apply his studied target bonuses against that target (including to the normal weapon damage {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}).
At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the bonuses on weapon attack rolls, damage rolls and to character save DCs against a studied target increase by 1.
At 7th level, a character can study an opponent as a move or {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.

features.name: Sneak Attack
features.desc:
If a character can catch an opponent when he is unable to defend himself effectively from her {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, she can strike a vital spot for extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
The character's attack deals extra damage anytime her target would be denied a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} (whether the target actually has a Dexterity bonus or not), or when the character {g|Encyclopedia:Flanking}flanks{/g} her target. This extra damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} and increases by 1d6 at later levels. This additional damage is precision damage and is not multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
The character must be able to see the target well enough to pick out a vital spot and must be able to {g|Encyclopedia:Reach}reach{/g} such a spot.

features.name: Divine Insight
features.desc: At 5th level, you gain an insight {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier on all Lore and Knowledge {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.

features.name: Studied Target (Swift)
features.desc:
A character can study an opponent he can see as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. The character then gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against it. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs of character class abilities against that opponent increase by 1.
If a character deals sneak attack damage to a target, he studies that target, allowing him to apply his studied target bonuses against that target (including to the normal weapon damage {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}).
At 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the bonuses on weapon attack rolls, damage rolls and to character save DCs against a studied target increase by 1.
At 7th level, a character can study an opponent as a move or {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.

features.name: Stonestrike
features.desc: Once per day per paladin level, a stonelord can draw upon the power of the living rock. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, she treats her {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} until the beginning of her next turn (whether armed or {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g}) as magical and adamantine with a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th level and every 5 levels thereafter.

features.name: Heartstone
features.desc: At 2nd level, a stonelord's flesh becomes progressively rockier. She gains a +1 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} N/adamantine where N is equal to half her paladin level. The natural armor bonus increases by +1 at 6th level, and every four levels thereafter, to a maximum of +5 at 18th level.

features.name: Defensive Powers
features.desc: As a stalwart defender gains levels, he augments his defensive stance. Starting at 2nd level, the stalwart defender gains a defensive power. He gains another defensive power for every two levels of stalwart defender attained after 2nd level. The stalwart defender gains the benefits of defensive powers only while in a defensive stance, and some of these powers require him to take an {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g} first. Unless otherwise noted, he cannot select an individual power more than once.

features.name: Stone Body
features.desc: At 20th level, a stonelord's body transforms into living stone. She no longer needs to eat, drink, breathe, or sleep, and she becomes immune to paralysis, poison, and stunning. She also becomes immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.

features.name: Stoneblood
features.desc:
At 3rd level, a stonelord's vitals begin to calcify and her blood transforms into liquid stone. She gains a 25% chance to ignore a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} or precision {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This does not stack with fortification armor or similar effects.
At 9th level, this chance increases to 50% and she becomes immune to petrification.
At 15th level, this chance increases to 75% and she becomes immune to bleed.

features.name: Defensive Stance
features.desc:
At 1st level, a stalwart defender can enter a defensive stance, a position of readiness and trance-like determination. A stalwart defender can maintain this stance for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + his {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. At each level after 1st, he can maintain the stance for 2 additional rounds per day. Temporary increases to Constitution, such as those gained from the defensive stance and {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} like bear's endurance, do not increase the total number of rounds that the stalwart defender can maintain a defensive stance per day. The stalwart defender can enter a defensive stance as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}. The total number of rounds of defensive stance per day is renewed after resting for 8 hours, although these hours do not need to be consecutive. While in a defensive stance, a stalwart defender gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, thrown weapon damage rolls, and Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. In addition, he gains a +2 dodge bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g} and 2 temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Die{/g}. While in a defensive stance, a stalwart defender cannot willingly move from his current position through any means.
The stalwart defender can end his defensive stance as a free {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}; after ending the stance, he is fatigued for a number of rounds equal to 2 times the number of rounds spent in the stance. A stalwart defender cannot enter a new defensive stance while fatigued or exhausted but can otherwise enter a stance multiple times during a single encounter or combat. If a stalwart defender falls {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g}, his defensive stance immediately ends, placing him in peril of death. A defensive stance requires a level of emotional calm, and it may not be maintained by a character in a rage (such as from the rage class feature or the rage spell).

features.name: Stonebane
features.desc: At 11th level, when using stonestrike, a stonelord's {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} gains the construct bane special weapon ability.

name: Paladin
desc: Paladins serve as beacons for their allies within the chaos of battle. While deadly opponents of evil, they can also empower goodly souls to aid in their crusades. Their magic and martial {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g} also make them well suited to defending others and blessing the fallen with the {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strength{/g} to continue fighting.
spells: Blessing of Luck and Resolve, Mass

archetypes.name: Divine Hunter
archetypes.desc: Most paladins rush into battle, meeting evil toe to toe. The divine hunter prefers to engage evil from afar, striking down her foes before they can {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threaten{/g} her allies.

archetypes.name: Hospitaler
archetypes.desc: Paladins are known for their charity and for tending to the sick. The hospitaler takes to this calling above all others, spending much of her time {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} the poor, and giving aid and succor to those in need.

archetypes.name: Divine Guardian
archetypes.desc:
The divine guardian devotes herself to the protection and guardianship of one creature at a time, be that her liege lord, an allied cleric, or an innocent facing overwhelming danger at the hands of evil.
The divine guardian devotes herself to the concerns of the material world, eschewing some divine studies. She does not gain access to divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g}.

archetypes.name: Warrior of the Holy Light
archetypes.desc: Some paladins use their gifts to focus on the holy light that shines within their souls. With the gifts of purity and redemption, these paladins spend much of their lives helping others find the true path. Unleashing this power takes patience and comes at a steep price.

archetypes.name: Martyr
archetypes.desc: Every paladin's code instructs him to put the welfare of others before his own, but some paladins take this farther than most, shouldering the direst suffering of the world onto themselves in order to help others and inspiring their allies to achieve heights of valor rather than seeking the glory for themselves.

archetypes.name: Divine Scion
archetypes.desc: Divine scions are paladins, who improve their battle prowess not only through faith, but also through knowledge. They study their enemies to find the most efficient methods of dealing with them.

archetypes.name: Stonelord
archetypes.desc: A stonelord is a devoted sentinel of dwarven enclaves, drawing the power of the earth and ancient stone to protect her people.
